group_1.narration: Quit pretendin' to be asleep and open your eyes.
The house we crashed in was quiet.@There was no sign of anyone around.
I didn't hear back from Sena.@Or rather, she was nowhere to be found.
At first I thought she'd come back@when I woke up from bed,@but I soon learned otherwise.
For the time being, she had vanished…@She was gone from my sight.
By sheer dumb luck, though,@I discovered that if I shared my magic@with her, she'd come back.
Yeah, that…was some time ago.
Sena didn't show up for several days,@but I could still feel her presence, so I got desperate@and tried splittin' my magic with her…
And the next day, Sena was back,@all bright-eyed and bushy-tailed.
It wasn't something I intended to do,@so I don't even know how it works, exactly.
But after a lot of experimentin'@and askin' questions, I came@to some conclusions.
For one, Sena doesn't remember the times@when she was gone.
Second, Sena's persona always consumes magic.
It's like gas, basically.@Sena always needs magic in@order to do anything.
If too much gets consumed,@she becomes invisible,@and if she completely runs out, she'll…
Maybe given enough time, Sena could've@figured out how to control her form@and keep her use of magic in check.@Then we wouldn't have a problem…
But time was running out.

group_1.textCenter: Given how much I'm sharin' my magic and usin' suggestion…no wonder it's in this condition.
I probably should quit usin' suggestion…

group_1.narration: But I couldn't stop now.@The grand finale wasn't ready yet.

group_1.textCenter: Gotta use my Grief Seed for now, then…
Ahaha… I should've listened to what she said.

group_1.narration: I've been doin' this so much that my collection@of Grief Seeds has almost run out…
Frankly, it's actually a good thing she ain't here…@I don't know how she'd react if she found out.
Naw, I know exactly how she'd react.
She'd tell me to quit sharin' my magic with her.
…Who the hell would do something like that?
I'll never let Sena vanish in front of me again.
When I'm alone, my heart is such@a mess that I can't sleep…
I can't wait to see her.@I can't wait to see her smile again…

group_1.textCenter: I guess I was the one clinging onto you@in the end, huh? …Ahaha.

group_1.narration: But it's fine if I just do it a little longer, yeah?
Let's do more funny things together…@Let's fuck up all this shit for good…
I'll make sure you'll always remember this time@we spent together as somethin' precious…
I guess it looks like…
This will be our parting memory.
